What is the purpose of the `getspentinfo` method in Verus?
The `getspentinfo` method in Verus returns the transaction ID (txid) and index where a specific output is spent.

getspentinfo Returns the txid and index where an output is spent. Arguments: {  "txid" (string) The hex string of the txid  "index" (number) The start block height } Result: {  "txid" (string) The transaction id  "index" (number) The spending input index  ,... } Examples: > verus getspentinfo '{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getspentinfo", "params": [{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getspentinfo
What is the format of the result returned by the `getspentinfo` method?

The result returned by the `getspentinfo` method is a JSON object with the following format:

```
{
  "txid" (string): The transaction ID,
  "index" (number): The spending input index,
 ...
}
```

getspentinfo Returns the txid and index where an output is spent. Arguments: {  "txid" (string) The hex string of the txid  "index" (number) The start block height } Result: {  "txid" (string) The transaction id  "index" (number) The spending input index  ,... } Examples: > verus getspentinfo '{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getspentinfo", "params": [{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getspentinfo
How can I use the `getspentinfo` method using the Verus CLI?

You can use the `getspentinfo` method using the Verus CLI by running the following command:
```
verus getspentinfo '{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}'
```
Replace the `txid` and `index` values with the desired values.

How can I use the `getspentinfo` method using cURL?

You can use the `getspentinfo` method using cURL by running the following command:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getspentinfo", "params": [{"txid": "0437cd7f8525ceed2324359c2d0ba26006d92d856a9c20fa0241106ee5a597c9", "index": 0}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace the `myusername` value with your actual username, and the `txid` and `index` values with the desired values.
